entry.title: documentScan: Add ash crosapi layer to cancel a scan
entry.content:
CancelScan will cancel an active scan that was previously started via

StartPreparedScan.



This simply forwards the request to lorgnette and sends the response

back. The majority of this change is converting between protobuf and

mojom.

entry.title: WebNN: Add the IDL definition of layerNormalization operator
entry.content:
This CL adds the IDL definition layerNormalization, adds the validation

steps and implements MLGraphBuilder::layerNormalization() for building

layerNormalization operator in MLGraph.



Spec for layer normalization operation is here:

https://pr-preview.s3.amazonaws.com/webmachinelearning/webnn/pull/478.html#api-mlgraphbuilder-layernorm



This CL also fixes the wrong type of parameter `rank` in method

ValidateAxes() to prevent bad inexplicit cast from size_t to uint32_t.



Bug: 1273291

Change-Id: I57ac37810c2c29f7ed4706c77f6ad9d155481fd0

entry.title: Extend expired preload scanner related metrics
entry.content:
This CL extend two expired UMA metrics measuring the preload scanner

performance.



Currently we can't see "Blink.ScanAndPreloadTime" and

"Blink.FetchQueuedPreloadsTime" UMAs on the dashboard, both are

important metrics for the LCPP projects to let us know whether the

preload scanner performance is regressed or not.

entry.title: Revert "infra: Remove 'Linux ChromiumOS MSan Builder' from tree-closers for now"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 6044e6ba731df9554fc6a71d9cf4936dc8dfb1ff.



Reason for revert: the issue was fixed by https://crrev.com/c/5076792



Original change's description:

> infra: Remove 'Linux ChromiumOS MSan Builder' from tree-closers for now

>

> The builder keeps failing during random links and closing the tree:

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Builder/62913/overview

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Builder/62910/overview

>

> So this will prevent the builder from closing the tree while it's

> linking is stabilized (crbug.com/1505350).

entry.title: Fix Windows build when Print Preview is disabled
entry.content:
Windows uses PrintingService even when Print Preview is disabled. As

such, adjust the build rules so that the Windows build always includes

PrintingService. Then adjust PrintingService itself to mark some of its

code as only for Print Preview.

entry.title: Add mojo bindings for Privacy Sandbox DevUI
entry.content:
Add initial mojo bindings for the Privacy Sandbox DevUI page. These are

expected to be only accessed by DevUI (chrome://) pages and to be

read-only methods for the foreseeable future that are not able to mutate

browser state.



Content settings data is already exposed to WebUI pages and ContentSettingsPattern::ToString has some fuzzing coverage in

content_settings_pattern_parser_fuzzer.cc.



Bug: b:308167671

entry.title: documentScan: Add ash crosapi layer to set and retrieve options
entry.content:
SetOptions will set the specified options using a scanner handle that

was returned from a call to OpenScanner. GetOptionGroups will return

the option groups from a scanner opened via OpenScanner.



Both of these simply forward requests to lorgnette and send responses

back. The bulk of this change is converting between protobuf and mojom.

entry.title: Create ER_SKIPPED.
entry.content:
On CrOS, unlike on other platforms, input events can be passed to

(Lacros) Chrome before the dispatcher (Ash) can handles it. In such a

case, sometimes events are not consumed by (Lacors) Chrome and

returned to the dispatcher (Ash).



This patch adds a new EventResult::ER_SKIPPED, which can be used to

indicate that the event should not be propagated further but should

be handled by the dispatcher (e.g. Ash) instead.



Bug: b/311473457

Change-Id: I4c26e977475039f433521f3dff24e2f5a0531a97

entry.title: [ios blink] Disable |viewport_enabled| for web-platform-tests.
entry.content:
This CL disables |viewport_enabled| to address an issue where

the visual viewport always provides its own scrollbars[1], even

when the test includes .

To align with Mac Port and prevent this behavior, |viewport_enabled|

sets to false.

This also eliminates the need for the previous ViewportStyle::kDefault

setting.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/visual_viewport.cc;drc=d4a7d3fb6f5100019d6153d5cf00c60f06b1d0a2;l=729

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Fix CDEF params setup for AV1 10bit
entry.content:
The ligbav1 parser is left shifting the CDEF strength values

(crrev/c/2166554), which is different from the AV1 spec.

(https://aomediacodec.github.io/av1-spec/#cdef-params-syntax). So we

need to right shift them back to setup |v4l2_av1_cdef| params for the

driver. We are no longer getting crashes from validate_av1_cdef()

from the v4l2 core after the fix.



Bug: b:281532908

TEST: v4l2_stateless_decoder --video=av1-1-b10-00-quantizer-10_20210310.ivf --v=4 --md5 --frames=1

Change-Id: Id0d691e5fe47e46a0d64b781dd7b2325d787e714

entry.title: Revert "[omnibox][webui] Intentionally oversize popup for debugging on Win & Mac"
entry.content:
This reverts commit a9819020a43ebde440bfa4717024bb0e2512c387.



Reason for revert: Popup already fixed by https://crrev.com/c/5046112

The problem was that the page was crashing because it depended on

some variable binding that was included for realbox but excluded

for webui omnibox popup. Binding all variables for all uses in the

shared implementation resolved the issue, so this CL intended to

aid debugging is no longer necessary.

> [omnibox][webui] Intentionally oversize popup for debugging on Win & Mac

entry.title: Fix the broken tests When AppStorage is enabled(Part II).
entry.content:
When the kAppServiceStorage flag is enabled, AppService blocks the app

publishing until it's ready, after reading from the AppStorage file.

This affects some tests, because they depend on apps in AppService.



So add WaitForAppServiceProxyReady in Setup to wait for AppServiceProxy

to read the AppStorage file to be ready.



BUG=1385932, b:307623506

entry.title: Eliminate base::Passed() usage in DLP notifications.
entry.content:
views::Button::PressedCallback supports OnceCallbacks now, so just use a

OnceCallback and eliminate the need to use base::Passed().



For consistency, the various UI callbacks have all been migrated to

OnceCallback consistently, and `base::OnceClosure` used as a shorter

synonym for `base::OnceCallback`.

entry.title: nudge-migration: Migrate autozoom nudge to new System Nudge framework
entry.content:
Use AnchoredNudgeManager to create the autozoom nudge and guard this new

code under a `IsSystemNudgeMigrationEnabled` flag.



Migration proposal in https://goto.google.com/system-nudge-v2.

of smaller vector icons. For this first iteration the nudge was updated

entry.title: Allow views::Button::PressedCallback to take a OnceClosure.
entry.content:
There are several places in the codebase that use `base::Passed()` but

only want a one-shot callback with `PressedCallback`; now they can do

that.



The backing storage is also changed to use a variant, since a

OnceCallback cannot be easily adapted into a RepeatingCallback. One nice

side effect of this is the RepeatingClosure case, where the ui::Event is

simply ignored, no longer needs an intermediate trampoline callback.



Bug: 1326449

entry.content:
All uses of override_compile_targets are using the same value that would

be used for the test's compile targets already (the target in the test

CL removes the field from the perf spec generator to reduce the

entry.title: Remove RealTimeDownloadProtectionAllowed policy
entry.content:
RealTimeDownloadProtectionAllowed was added to Chrome on CrOS in M114

as unlisted. Since Standard Safe Browsing is an essential service for

DPChromeOS, this policy is no longer needed. Since the policy was never

added to Admin Console and no UI was added to allow end-users to set

the policy, the pref and policy can be removed completely.



BYPASS_POLICY_COMPATIBILITY_CHECK=The policy was never exposed to

end-users on Admin Console and was left as unlisted.

entry.title: [ios] Fix focus animation glitch on landscape iPhone
entry.content:
This fixes a slight glitch in the animation when focusing the omnibox

when in landscape on iphone. The issue was that the toolbar wasn't

quite in the 100% scrolled position so as the omnibox focused, there is

a moment where it glitches a couple of pixels vertically in the middle

of the animation. This fixes that by ensuring that the omnibox is in

position vertically before beginning the focus animation, which expands

horizontally to fill the toolbar.



Before the fix:

http://screencast/cast/NjUyODc3NzI3MzIxMjkyOHxiZGI2MDliYi04ZA



After the fix:

http://screencast/cast/NDg4NTg2MTU1MTMwODgwMHw0MjhmMDBmOC1iZg



(Note: to see the glitch, you may need to go frame by frame)

entry.content:
Enable PDF extension accessibility tests for OOPIF PDF that work as-is

and requires little to no test modifications.



In order to do so, change RunTest() to not need a MimeHandlerViewGuest,

as the only purpose for the guest is to check if the PDF has loaded.

entry.title: bounds_tracker: WindowBoundsTracker maintains the Observing window list
entry.content:
- Let WindowBoundsTracker track the window activation changes, and

observe the window that would have its own WindowState.

- Track the window's root window changes inside WindowBoundsTracker,

remap or restore the window on this change.

- Only applying the remap/restore on root window changes because of

moving the active window through the shortcut `alt+search+m` or

display removal.

- Remove the callsites of RemapOrRestore because of window's root

window changes. As now it is handled by WindowBoundsTracker itself

instead.

entry.title: Update segment queue on network speed change
entry.content:
Whenever a segment finishes it's fetch, it notifies the

HlsManifestDemuxerEngine of the new network speed, which now updates the

RenditionSelector, which can decide to select a new rendition. If this

happens, a new manifest will be fetched and the rendition will be

updated. The next time a state check takes place, the segment queue will

have been updated, and a different quality rendition will adapt into

being played.

entry.title: media_app: Ditch `js2gtest`.
entry.content:
js2gtest adds a lot of complexity that will hinder efforts to convert

these files to TypeScript. It's not really getting us much anyway since

we had to overhaul things to support JS modules. WebUIs outside of

ChromeOS have already completely moved off js2gtest (crbug/1457360).



We also want to decouple from the old `test_api.js` machinery and

deprecated WebUi testing machinery using `chrome.send`. But that

requires more intrusive changes that will be less scary with TypeScript.



To ease the transition, a simplified test runner is introduced that

performs similar steps to what js2gtest was doing in its generated

code. Sufficient machinery from BaseWebUIBrowserTest is implemented

using `EvalJs` rather than `chrome.send` that hooks into this test

runner.



I'm calling it `isolatedTestRunner` because, like js2gtest (but unlike most mocha tests using WebUIMochaBrowserTest), each test case runs in

its own browser test process, in a fresh navigation, isolated from other

test cases.



Bug: b:160274783

Test: Tested various test failure cases to ensure error messaging is

Test: good and errors are propagated to a gtest failure.

Change-Id: Ibb1e6da55e114d41a918ea0efb82fc0683b6f0bd

despite the scroller being styled with scroll-behavior: smooth.



This behavior is tested in WPT by scroll-behavior-subframe-root.html

entry.title: BugFix: Remove ReadPixels src_rect dimensions validation check
entry.content:
Remove CopySharedImageHelper::ReadPixels src_rect dimensions check

which causes issues with plx dashboards that create a canvas. The

renderer client should ideally create a new shared image with new

scaled size but due to incorrect size mismatch the rect size passed

in is greater than expected shared image size due to which it fails

validation. This change removes validation as a workaround until the

appropriate renderer client is updated at which point it should be

added back.

entry.title: [FSA] Fix a crash in the destruction of SAHs in incognito
entry.content:
SAHs hold locks on their file. When we attempt to create another SAH on

that file, we will evict the current lock if we need to and we can.

Until the lock is destroyed, the new SAH is waiting to be created. The

destruction of the old SAH triggers the destruction of the lock which

then triggers the creation of the new SAH.



In the FileSystemAccessManagerImpl, this means

`access_handle_host_receivers_`'s `erase` could call into its `insert`

which is undefined behavior. This separates the erasing from that set

and the destruction of the SAH.



This bug only happened in incognito because of some checks that are

skipped in incognito which allows all of this to happen synchronously.



Bug: 1382215

Change-Id: Ib92d6de2843710472450def0453d63db6756464c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5081251

entry.title: Reland "Initialize feature and field trial state in app shims."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 05dc0d76b85428669a02367bb967477e7e0b0411



This fixes a lifetime issue with the second WaitableEvent in

AppShimController's ScopedSynchronizeThreads helper that was

revealed by ASAN bots.



Original change's description:

> Initialize feature and field trial state in app shims.

>

> App shim execution roughly follows three phases:

> 1) Early startup, which finds the correct chrome framework to dlopen.

> 2) Bootstrap, where the shim either finds a running chrome instance

> to connect to, or launches a new chrome instance.

> 3) Running, after communication has been established with chrome.

>

> There is no need for base::Feature support in 1), as the code there

> should be as minimal as possible, and depend on as little chrome code

> as possible.

>

> In 3) we want to make sure that feature state exactly matches that of

> the chrome version we're connected to. To accomplish this, in the first

> mojo message reply from chrome to the app shim we pass along the feature

> and field trial state for the app shim to use, and initialize

> FieldTrialList and FeatureList with that.

>

> In 2) we can't guarantee that the feature state exactly matches that of

> the chrome version we will be connecting to. As such we don't want to

> allow unfettered base::Feature usage here, but some usage (for example

> in mojo code, but also soon in some other places) is/will be

> unavoidable. Since in this case code has to be able to deal with the

> feature state not matching chrome, explicit opt-in is required.

>

> To initialize feature state in 2) we do two different things:

> - For app shims launched by chrome, we pass feature and field trial

> state on the command line.

> - For app shims launched directly by the OS or user, chrome writes

> the feature/field trial state the last time it ran to a file in

> user data dir. This file is then read by the app shim to initialize

> its state. Additionally we also apply explicit enabled/disabled

> features passed on the command line, and forward these to chrome if

> the app shim ends up launching chrome.

>

> Bug: 1378728

> Change-Id: I1db33ffe7cd350eabe5819532eb267a0ebfcc449

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4860440

> Reviewed-by: Mark Mentovai

> Commit-Queue: Marijn Kruisselbrink

> Reviewed-by: Alexei Svitkine

> Reviewed-by: Dibyajyoti Pal

> Reviewed-by: Rebekah Potter

> Reviewed-by: Tom Sepez

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1231606}



Bug: 1378728

Change-Id: I4e8d6c63d8fd9d8df42e221cfb4c5f6814623f99

entry.title: Create single source of truth for OpenXrInteractionProfileType
entry.content:
Moves OpenXrInteractionProfileType to be entirely defined within mojom

to allow for re-use with the xr_browser_tests and removing a switch

statement to switch between the two types. For consistency, renames the

`kWMRMotion` from the original definition to `kMicrosoftMotion`. Also

keeps the `kInvalid` value from the mojom in place of `kCount` since

mojom automatically creates a kMaxValue, and keeping kInvalid as the

max value allows usage to continue as is, but looks more semantically

appropriate.

entry.title: [ActionManager] Simplify ActionViewController templates and implement ActionViewInterface
entry.content:
This CL creates an ActionViewInterface that will be implemented for

each view class that wants to have ActionViewController support. The

role of the ActionViewInterface is to create a middle layer between

ActionViewController and view that allows custom behaviors dependent

on the view type. This replaces the original template specialization

of the equivalent functions and ActionViewInterface classes will

directly inherit from their ancestor ActionViewInterface

implementation. Comments on action_view_interface.h describe how it

should be implemented.



Some include statements had to be added to other unrelated files to

fix indirect dependencies that were broken.



Bug: 1497765

entry.title: Add virtual display controller classes and tests.
entry.content:
1) Adds DisplayDriverController which is a primitive wrapper for

setting display configurations. It also detects if the driver is

installed.

2) Adds VirtualDisplayWinUtil which mirrors the mac version

(VirtualDisplayMacUtil) and reconciles detected displays with the

set configuration.

3) Adds a test which adds/removes displays and ensures display IDs

are not invalidated between calls.

4) Adds some helper code to get the manufacturer and product code

from windows monitor handles.





Bug: 1034772

entry.title: [navigation API] Fix flaky scroll restoration test
entry.content:
after-transition-intercept-handler-modifies.html sometimes fails

because the scroll restoration is being overridden if the layout

changes from the previous same document navigation have not yet been

applied. This becomes more consistent when same document navigation IPCs

are prioritized (see crrev.com/c/4981177).



This CL changes the test to ensure rendering happens between the forward

and back navigations, which in turn ensures the new layout and scroll

position were updated before navigating back.



Bug: 1042118

Change-Id: Ia6a3768f8780f9ddaff80f7fd877ddca5c6184b7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5080962

Commit-Queue: Scott Haseley

Reviewed-by: Nate Chapin

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1232997}

entry.title: Store the 'owner_email' returned from the Directory when provisioning
entry.content:
This CL adds some code to store the owner_email which is returned

from the Directory when provisioning a machine. The reason this is

needed is that for some provisioning scenarios, the user is not

known at runtime and the backend service will determine which

account to provision for. For this scenario, --corp-user will

contain a backend-defined value which indicates that it needs to

lookup the owner.



Bug: b:297857922

Change-Id: Ifc6183333b932f17397729e4e0a66431c85aa73a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5084748

entry.title: Remove unnecessary use of base::Passed in ash holding space UI.
entry.content:
The callbacks are bound with `base::BindOnce()`, but there is no reason

they can't be bound with `base:BindRepeating()` instead.



That being said, there is an opportunity for improvement here: the

observer callbacks are bound with WeakPtr receivers, and callbacks bound

with WeakPtr receivers cannot return a non-void type. The workaround is

to use a trampoline callback to run the wrapped callback, before

returning true.



This trampoline could be eliminated and the code further simplified if

the animation callback observer allowed the use of base::OnceCallbacks

to create one-shot observers.



Bug: 1326449

Bug: 1506856

Change-Id: I2e9833365269dd699000b5c9e410df965f66e89c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5078799

entry.title: documentScan: Add openScanner and closeScanner
entry.content:
documentScan.openScanner takes a scanner ID returned from

documentScan.getScannerList, opens the corresponding scanner for

exclusive access, and returns a handle that can be used for further

operations. documentScan.closeScanner closes a handle previously

returned from documentScan.openScanner.



All of the real work for these functions is done in the corresponding

DocumentScanAPIHandler functions. This CL adds the JS entry points and

matching apitests.



Bug: b:297435720

for class names, reference frame handling, and submission

to the driver.
